website_summaries.verdict: Whether you are hiking, camping, fishing, or just enjoying the great outdoors, you can count on these inexpensive yet sturdy shoe covers to survive for ages.
pros: Sized from small to extra large

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for Alaska...
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a 4-day fishing trip in Alaska and must say that these shoe covers held up very well. In my opinion, these are absolutely great to go over some sport shoes, if you don't want to spend $100, or more, on true rain shoes/boots. Be mindful - the waterproof material is very thin, so don't expect a boot-like performance for extended period of use. I bought them with intent to throw them away after this trip, as I did not want to spend any time washing away fish slime and grime. I was wearing size 9.5 work boots and XL fit me just fine with some jiggle room. They served me well, and I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Kay

customer_reviews.title: I took a chance and bought these for a trip ...
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and bought these for a trip to Canada. I didn't have room in my luggage for a pair of Wellies and I also needed to keep my luggage weight down. I wore these shoe covers while hiking in a heavily forested area and of course getting in and out of a Zodiac boat. My feet remained dry for the entire trip and the shoe covers were not punctured in any way. I was really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Strelitz

customer_reviews.title: Pack like a Light, Flat Pancake!
customer_reviews.text: Going to NYC- my NB walking shoes are mesh! What to do if it rains for days? I had to work at it but got my 8.5 women’s New Balance shoes into the Large. Be careful not to catch the zipper on its cover. So light, flat when folded, come in a resealable bag- I think they’ll be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: CATHI OAKES

customer_reviews.title: Heaviest rainfall in recorded history here, and these covers worked great!
customer_reviews.text: October 2018 has been our highest rainfall month ever recorded. We live on a ranch in Texas and our soil is heavy clay. When I work outside, I wear tall rubber boots, but many times I just need to make a short walk to one of our vehicles then go, without getting our car trashed with gooey clay. These covers slip on and off over our shoes (I bought a pair for me and a pair for my wife) and they are great when we get in the car, taking them off as we are halfway in, then placing the covers in a box we keep up front.
customer_reviews.author: Howdy

customer_reviews.title: BOOT SHOE COVER (WATERPROOF)
customer_reviews.text: These boot shoe covers are perfect to keep your feet dry during these tremendous downpours we keep have here in Houston Texas.
customer_reviews.author: John K. Towle

customer_reviews.title: Rain boos fold Flat
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these boots for our trip to New Orleans and Jazz Fest. A few times when we have gone to Jazz Fest we have had rain. It is at a fairground in New Orleans and get very messy when it rains. I only needed to use them for a short time this year, but they were so useful. Fold up flat, they are light, fit over shoes and cover jeans. They were not expensive. At Jazz Fest they should be selling these easy to use rain boots.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bailey

customer_reviews.title: beats trash bags!
customer_reviews.text: I will say first that I have been lucky enough (so far) not to need to use these. However, they do fit well (one size larger to be sure) the soles are thick enough for reasonable walks and do grip the pegs well. Also, they come up high enough to cover just about any boot and there is a flap that seals under the zipper. My only concern is that they are basically vinyl so they will melt if they touch a hot pipe. Having said that I will assume that Mom did not raise any idiots and try to avoid that situation.
customer_reviews.author: John McHan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to slip on, good in snowy and wet weather, good traction, worked for a person with foot / ankle braces.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these because I wear foot and ankle braces. With these, I could fit in my usual shoes and they'd be easy to fold up and take along when I needed to work in wet / snowy conditions. They work well. I had good traction on snow and ice and my feet stayed dry. They are easy and quick to slip on and off (believe me, this is a major concern for me). They are easy to clean. They fit my unusual needs very well. I have not used them enough yet to know how long they will last, but they seem to be pretty tough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how to judge these.. they ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how to judge these.. they do fit over my size 9.5 Converse. The sole on the bottom doesn't go from front to back perfectly, needs to be worked and stretched a little. Despite that, I still say they fit as expected. If I bought these again I might try to get something a half inch or an inch longer from front to back.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Maglio

customer_reviews.title: Did what they were supposed to do, kept my shoes dry
customer_reviews.text: My experience biking in these over the last two days: *6 miles, heavy rain, about 1 hr: one drip ran down the inside of a boot because I had rain pants tucked into boots *6 miles, lighter rain, about 45 min: everything stayed nice and dry because I learned from yesterday and kept rain pants over the boots So these worked great, far better than the rain pants but that's a different story...
customer_reviews.author: Experiment356

customer_reviews.title: A good staple to have in your "just in case" bag
customer_reviews.text: These are a great staple to have in your bag if you live in a rainy climate. Sometimes when you leave the house it could be sunny with not a cloud in the sky and then later quickly turn into a monsoon...so, when this happens and you did not wear the appropriate shoes, having these in your bag to throw on really come in handy! I walked in these for a while, in uneven and dirt terrain and they kept my feet/legs totally dry and also stayed intact. The quality of the boots seems to last fine and they are easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: D.Frances

customer_reviews.title: Largest size will not fit a large shoe. Size 12 boot shown.
customer_reviews.text: Runs way too small. I purchased the largest size possible - size XL - it does not fit size 12 shoes. It is much too short to fit a size 12 shoe of any kind. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia C.

customer_reviews.title: Seem good, run small.
customer_reviews.text: They look quite acceptable, but do run small. I trusted the 10.8 inches meassure, but it's unaccurate. They're more like 10.2 inches. I ordered a small size, should have gone for medium. I wear US 8.5 shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Diego ChE

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased these boots to use when cleaning dog runs out. The boots keep sliding down over my calf's. I work out and have decent size calves, so they shouldn't be sliding off. There is elastic at the top of the boots, but that's not though. There is even a button and zipper to keep them closed, but that still doesn't work. They should redesign it to where there is a draw string at the top of the boots as well as different length sizes as not everyone is the same size. I'm sure that would solve a lot of problems with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Liebert

customer_reviews.title: Snap tore out after just a few uses
customer_reviews.text: The snap that holds the rubber strap on already has torn out of the plastic/rubber. The strap is important to keep the boots on snug so now they are very floppy. Only wore them for a few times. Not good quality at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality boot. Too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: After, one day of use this rain boot ripped. Very disappointing I should have buy a real boot instead.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Runs too small
customer_reviews.text: If you wear Size 9-11 shoe, you need Size LARGE and not Medium like the product states. Quality of the product is pretty low, these are cheap and won't be lasting for very long methinks.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: falls down, failed quickly
customer_reviews.text: These shoe covers are just slightly better than plastic bags with rubber bands. They slip down constantly. There are two snap-on elastic straps, which unsnap somewhat easily (and that makes them slip easier). The soles are wearing after about five days of light use. If you stay 'on top' of keeping them adjusted, they do keep you dry. They are more bother than they are worth, in the end. Update: after 8-10 total hours of use over several days, a seam failed (separated) near the toe. That makes them useless, since they now collect water. For price vs durability, these are overpriced by a lot. Downgraded to one star. Disappointed, and beyond me how anyone rates these highly.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: Too Small even ordering a large size.
customer_reviews.text: The product was ok for the price. Very light weight, but thats not the problem. I ordered like another reviewer had said a size lg for my 9 to 9.5 shoe size. Still to small. The soles of these covers were not as long as my tennis shoes. I may try another shoe, but to me they would have alot more happy customers if they just put in a conversion shoe chart. Be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Zenobia

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Not at all as advertised. They may be light weight-5 stars, but the light weight makes them very poorly made. I've had them a couple of months, but recently used them cause winter here is rainy. They are no good for motorcycles. The material ripped in the toe the first use. The straps that come with them snap over the top but don't stay snapped in place. Overall, a hefty garbage bag is more durable then these shoes. Gonna have to buy a different brand and perhaps spend a little more. You get what you pay for. These shoes are very poor quality. I would never recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Rashu

customer_reviews.title: They don't stay up!
customer_reviews.text: I put these on to walk my dog after the rain. I walked maybe 20 steps before the left boot started slapping against the ground. I looked down and it had fallen off my shoe! So I reached down and pulled it back on, only to have it happen after 2 steps. My dog still had to pee, so I said fuggetaboutit, or something probably a little more offensive, and kept walk-flapping my dog. When I got back inside, I tried to unsnap the left snap and the freaking thing ripped right off! What they heck? I returned these puppies, thinking you get what you paid for. In this case you definitely do. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Charley  S Blunt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, handy boot covers, not very water proof.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid covers. Fit over sneakers, boots any shoe which is nice. They fold up rather compact which is good if youre caryying them in a bag. Out of the box they are water resistant under light conditions. I applied water resistant silcone spray and they become water proof which is nice. For the price and convience are nice you just need to further water proof them. They hold up in rough conditions, i use them for biking and no rips, tears or holes yet.
customer_reviews.author: Trey

customer_reviews.title: Right size
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to cover motorcycle boots in the rain. Unfortunately, riding season is almost over and I likely won't have a chance to use them before next spring. I ordered these not paying attention to the size. Upon arrival, I received size large. I have small feet and wear 8.5 men's boots and these large covers looked like they would be small. I was about to return them, but realize they are a perfect fit for the boots I'm wearing. The labeling shows size Large is 11.5" length. Measure your footwear first, others may want a larger size. For the price, I would recommend at least trying them.
customer_reviews.author: Chickenpiss

customer_reviews.title: X-Large barely fits over size 12 shoe. However very strong and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Material is strong and product is well made. I am a mail carrier and need durable covers. These fit that need very well. However I wear a size 12 and bought the extra large. They are barely big enough to fit over my tennis shoes. They will not fit over any boots in my size. You will tear them.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly dry shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take to Disneyland just in case it rained, and as it turns out we were there for three days and it poured every single day. These boot covers kept our feet dry and fit perfectly over our shoes. One pair ripped on the zipper and the button came off on the last day, but I’m still giving 5 stars because of the price. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Luckylady

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time I took them camping in the snow
customer_reviews.text: The heel on one of them separated from the rest of the boot. You can imagine how much of a hassle this was to deal with as I hiked a few miles in the snow. I had to wrap trash bags around my non-waterproof boot. I shouldn't have assumed that it would be this easy and cheap to deal with snow, but the description on this product says it's built for snow.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey T.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for covering surgical boot
customer_reviews.text: I had foot surgery in December and went on a trip to Vermont afterwards. I wanted to use these boot covers so I could still walk outside in the snow and engage in outdoor activities. They did not fit over my surgical boot and I couldn't play in the snow with my son. I'm not sure anyone will ever think to use these covers for the purpose I did, but it's good to know, in case someone is looking for that type of solution. Maybe if I got a larger size it would work? But then they may not be walkable due to the big size.
customer_reviews.author: Sarita

customer_reviews.title: So happy to find these!
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for a rainy camping trip. I'm not sure how they would hold up with long distance walking but they were great for me around the campground. The top elastic is a bit tight with no adjustment which may bother some with average to above average calf size. My calves are thin and it was fine. I wear a size 8.5 women's show and the Large was perfect. Wishing they had a larger size for my husband who wears a men's 12. I recommend and will buy another pair for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: I4 detail

customer_reviews.title: Thinner material than I'd hoped for
customer_reviews.text: As a kid in the 60s, I remember heavy rubber "galoshes" or "overshoes" that went over regular shoes with a folding expandable side panel and a button/elastic eye closure at the top. That was what I was looking for. These are suitable, but the zipper is fussy, the snap at the top is MUCH too tight for my calf (I'm 5'9 and weigh 160 lbs so my calves are not extraordinarily large) and the material is very thin. OK for the price, but somewhat disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Liz Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great in the mud!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for me. I’ve been working in a very muddy backyard for a week or me. It’s a soggy muddy mess I been trenching to control it a little. Anyway, I bought these because I needed to keep my shoes clean while working out there with my shovel. They work great. For the money you can’t beat them. They stand up fine to my shoveling - pretty thick bottom. The zipper and snaps are fine. Remember these aren’t $170 waterproof boots that you can use and abuse and beat the heck out of. For the periodic messes I deal with they work great!
customer_reviews.author: TeleFalcon

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair to protect my feet from get wet while on a trip to Milwaukee Wisconsin in January 2020. While there they had a major winter storm and plenty of snow. I was a couple weeks out of foot surgery and could not get my feet wet. These went right over my medical shoe and never let any water in. Great job. Now I’m back home in Texas I still use them on rainy days to keep my tennis shoes mud free. I have put them through the ringer and they are still going strong. Would absolutely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Kaiser

customer_reviews.title: I Finally Found a Waterproof Boot
customer_reviews.text: As a daily motorcycle commuter, finding ways to deal with the elements has become one of my hobbies. I've learned 'waterproof' doesn't mean 'watertight'. After several attempts, I gave up on fashion and opted for dry footwear and socks. I wear a size 11, short boot and these XL covers fit perfectly. They are made of a relatively heavy plastic material which stretches without tearing when I pull them on. However, if abused the material will tear. I've used them on several occasions and they have become an important part of my rainy weather kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Franck

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product
customer_reviews.text: Two snaps tore out while trying to remove the boots after their second use. This rendered one boot unusable and unfixable.
customer_reviews.author: John I. Oines

customer_reviews.title: Useful Travel
customer_reviews.text: Used in Europe this spring and they worked well during a windy and cold rainy day of walking about. These are not built for long term use but for our travel needs they were perfect. Easy to pack and good for a few walks keeping our shoes and shins dry. Similar rain gear was for sale near our hotel but they were not as nice as these. The instructions on how to find the right size were confusing but we did get the right ones. Buying larger means they are less likely to tear on you.
customer_reviews.author: FoxRun

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I got suckered by the low price. Wore these a couple weeks ago in an Oklahoma rain storm walking to my bus stop. They kept falling down to my ankles. They're uncomfortable to walk in. If you're not walking long distances, they might be ok. I'm keeping these for short walks, but invested instead in some high quality rain shoes and rain pants for long walks and commutes.
customer_reviews.author: toolsa

customer_reviews.title: You won’t regret these.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these (XL size) over a pair of 9 1/2 Bates steel toe boots. They are a perfect fit for those boots. Rode through a heavy thunderstorm on a sportster last week and my feet were dry as a bone when I got home. Paired with a Viking two piece rain suit, it was just another ride in the saddle. The only complaint I have is that the bottom texture is not aggressive at all, and I do worry about putting my foot down on anything even slightly slick. Maybe they’d be fine, but it just feels a little too smooth for my liking. As far as fit and finish though, 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bavousett

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly waterproof thru huge rainstorm
customer_reviews.text: Got caught in rainstorm on motorcycle from Mid-IN to north of Chicago. Boot covers worked perfect. Only negative was that the elastic straps came off on one of the boots even thou I reattached multiple times it eventually flew off while riding. Other than that worked great.
customer_reviews.author: M.K.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STRIPPER SHOE COVERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: It took me some time to do my research & finally make a purchase for the crew to cover our feet & protect from stripper and wax. All pairs held up and I'm still using mine to scrub/recoat floors in a school now! I would say we all used them a total of about 7-10 times and I never expected them to last this long based on price. Completely satisfied! Hopefully they'll make it through the next school 🤞
customer_reviews.author: DzEyez

customer_reviews.title: nice for riding the bike in the rain
customer_reviews.text: they work well, are water proof and great to put on top of shoes. One small caveat: it can be a bit difficult to get into with larger shoes as there is an inside cover of the zipper. But I prefer this as like that no water can go through the zipper. I'm actually looking forward now to bike rides in the snow
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR COLD WEATHER KAYAKING
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR. I CAN WEAR LONG PANTS, SOCKS AND SHOES AND WADE OUT INTO THE RIVER TO GET IN MY KAYAK. NICE SOLE, BUT I DON'T WALK AROUND IN THEM ON ROUGH GROUND, SO THEY WILL LAST LONGER. FOR THE PRICE THEY CAN'T BE BEAT. I WEAR A WOMANS 9.5 AND GOT THE LARGE (11.8") AND THEY ARE LARGE ENOUGH TO GET ON EASILY. NO MORE COLD WET FEET!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!!
customer_reviews.text: It is raining today so I got these out to use for the first time. My feet kept slipping off of the pedals. I tried multiple times just to make sure it wasn't me. Finally had the good sense to take them off and finish my ride safely with my tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but not for a hot Motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great for things other than a motorcycle in my opinion. I tried them in the rain and they did keep me dry but my concern is heat from the bike melting them if I happen to place my feet close to the pipes/engine. The fabric is similar to a blow up pool, same rubber type smell when you open them. For my safety I will spend more instead of trying to cut corners on rain gear. The material does not breath so additional heat builds up.
customer_reviews.author: Wan2Live

customer_reviews.title: Good for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I have a hike coming up that crosses 5 streams. The streams are close together so keeping these on for the duration of crossing the streams will make sense. They vinyl is tough, much like wading boots. Very compact and lightweight to carry in a backpack. My Merrell Moab II size 11 hikers were a tight fit but did fit. Depending on the width of streams you are crossing, waterproof hiking boots or plastic bags could work equally as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Worst spent money Period. Please don't waist, your time and money buying it crappy Items
customer_reviews.author: Neumberto Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Not worth my money. Please read my review
customer_reviews.text: First off there made in China, 2nd the straps that you see near the ankle are fake and worth less. There butting one's and they keep popping off after just 2 hours of wearing them I lost one. Of the straps. And the material is super super thin after about 3 hours they started ripping. The size chart is fake asf. I'm size 10 and I got the size XL like the chart says to. And its way way to large for my shoes. They do not stay in place. You are better off buying boots or buying rain boots. Anything else is better than this.
customer_reviews.author: Rahman

customer_reviews.title: Great for CNA’s
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for when I am assisting my residents with bathing so that I don’t get my shoes wet. I wanted something convenient to put on where I didn’t need to take off my shoes or socks or worry about the bottoms of my pants getting wet. These are perfect! I definitely recommend for any CNA who needs to assist with bathing and showering.
customer_reviews.author: SARAH SCHMIDT

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This wasn't what I expected at all. This cover is like a cheap rain coat for your shoes. It's very light weight but in the same vein it's also very likely to tear with use. I chose my size based on the sizing chart and they were massive. There was no way I could use them so unfortunately I sent them back without ever trying them. Opted for a rain boot instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked PERFECTLY!
customer_reviews.text: We used these on our recent trip to Venice. They were compact and light weight so we could pack them VERY easily, and they were much more durable than the cheap plastic covers they were selling in Venice for more than these cost! Easy to put on, comfortable, and NO water came in. The tread and thick bottom was a PLUS. I'd recommend to anyone needing to wade in water.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ivey

customer_reviews.title: I love it!  No more doubts, lol.  I tested it...
customer_reviews.text: I love it! No more doubts, lol. I tested it, and it secured nicely with my shoes (women’s size 8) on! When I got home, dried with a towel, and my shoes and feet and legs nicely warm and dry! So far so good. And it’s a good match together with my new fake face full body and mobility motor scooter rain gear!
customer_reviews.author: surfergal

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I am allergic to fire ants and chiggers and I bought these boots to use while walking in a yard to help me avoid being attacked by them. These boots fit well over my large shoes and I have used them MANY times already, walking around while I was working in the yard. They are much more durable than I expected for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Mom

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, good looking and perfect for the job!
customer_reviews.text: Love them!!!, they are totally comfortable, keeps you dry no matter the situation, I use them for riding motorcycle and they are perfect!, no water on my shoes, pants or anything, very conformable, the materials are awesome, not too hot, the cold doesn't get through them so you are good on that side too. the under foot is very good, anti-slip very good to go indoors even when you are soaking wet. and even tho they are not top notch on the fashion side, actually they aren't ugly and actually looks pretty cool, love the design and the materials and they fit, perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Valle

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, but watch the size
customer_reviews.text: Easy on, easy off. Will definitely keep your feet dry in snow, rain or sleet. Has rubberized bottom for traction. However, watch the size. I wear a 8.5 men's shoe and barely fit properly into a Large size. Better to go up a size so that putting them on and taking them off is easier.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Glasser OD

customer_reviews.title: They Work! Keeps work boots dry in the rain
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for my boyfriend as he takes his motorcycle to work every morning. Florida weather is so bipolar and unpredictable. I got tired of him coming home soaked and his boots taking days to dry and stinking. This works amazing for him. Keeps his work boots nice and dry. Easy to carry and clean. He was very impressed as he didn't expect them to work very well but they did and I felt like a superhero lol.
customer_reviews.author: PATRIA

customer_reviews.title: Do what they suppose to
customer_reviews.text: Those covers do the job. I ride motorcycles for living, have to ride it in the rain, those covers are pretty good for the price. Just be sure you get size bigger then you think you need. I am size 10 and I end up ordering XL Pros: keeps water away Pretty light Cons Pretty bulky, need to get use to Seems like not going to list that long ( I ride everyday at least for 8hrs) Hark to walk in them
customer_reviews.author: RedRusskii

customer_reviews.title: Covered my size L fractured boot enough to protect it from getting wet!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect for what I needed! I am in a fracture boot, non weight bearing and want to dig clams on the rocky beach. Plastic bags did not work as the rocks punctured them when I rested my foot on them. This protected my boot! I bought the XXL.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome booties
customer_reviews.text: These are great booties for many types of jobs. I specifically use them for pressure cleaning, but after taking them off many times over, the clips that keep the booties stable break right off the material. Overall I'd still buy again because they're worth the price and does what its made for, just not longevity
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little small.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to LARP in and it is comfortable and waterproof. The only issue I would say would be sizing. I read other reviews and they let me know it ran small and they do. I wear a 10.5 American, and I bought the largest size they had, and they fit perfectly but if my shoes were larger I wouldn't be able to wear them. Otherwise a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Never got to use
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke before I even tried them on! They would have been nice for what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my feet dry
customer_reviews.text: This was the last thing I needed to make my bike rides water proof when it rains. Good quality and great sealing. Used it in the rain and drove through ponds of water, no wet feet. The size also fits great. I measured my shoes and compared it with the info provided by the seller. I cant say anything about durability yet.
customer_reviews.author: Angler Fish

customer_reviews.title: Held up in rain and hail storms!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use while marshaling at the AT&T Pebble Beach Golf Tournament which involved a lot of walking, rain, cold, mud and even a hailstorm! I heeded the advice of other comments and walked carefully and took caution in putting them on and taking them off to not damage them. The held up perfectly and kept my feet dry! The sizing is a little undersized as my 10W shoe tightly fit into an XL size shoe cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but not all that bad..
customer_reviews.text: Interesting product, but they work and serve a purpose. Not fashionable, as is stated on the package, but not all that bad....if you have a sense of humor. My husband laughed at me for buying them, but they do work.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Superior design,comfort,durability
customer_reviews.text: Wisest purchase made in a long time! Why ruin all your shoes,alcoholing them to death,when ya can just slip these on? They're fantastic protection in all elements,an ease to put on and remove. Sturdy,durable,and super happy with them.true to size,also....love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Bradigan

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: They were waterproof for all of 2 days. After which, they both had a whole above the area which the toebox would be located. As you can guess, this does mean they are no longer waterproof. If you need to keep your shoes dry for a total of 2 days, fantastic purchase. Any longer and you're out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, arrived with big hole in toe area due to separated seam
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged! As soon as I took it out of the plastic I saw there was a big hole right on the toe area because the seam was split open. Didn't even get to use them once. These are very poor quality, and I think even if they hadn't arrived defective, they would probably have ripped open at the seams on the first use. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tammany Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: DRY SHOES & FEET! READ TIP BELOW
customer_reviews.text: Kept our feet & shoes dry on 4 foot deep snow. On hardened snow, the grip could be better to prevent falling. TIP: Wear bulky shoes when using these. I wore hiking shoes inside and my girlfriend wore Vans, hers kept flapping at the bottom because the shoe cover was not filled up with her Vans
customer_reviews.author: Adrian G

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof without Question!
customer_reviews.text: 9-20-19 This product worked great. Just returned from 7 days on the Middle Fork of the Salmon River. in ID. Rained 4 days. This gear worked perfectly. Additionally, I sat in the front of our three man, framed, self bailing, rubber raft as we floated down the river each day. When the standing water in the rapids crashed over the bow and dosed me... No Problemo... Bring it on! The seasoned fisherman gave me grief for these... on the last day... guess who thought these booties were a pretty good idea... you go it... the seasoned fisherman! I wold purchase the again
customer_reviews.author: tom connolly

customer_reviews.title: Run Small in size but nice quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The sizing runs small for s motorcycle overboot. There’s no way these are sized at 12.5 as they just fit over my size 11 Alipinestars soft track shoes but there’s no chance fitting my cruiser boots of the same size. I’d say there Large at best when compared to Cycle Gear’s similar offering. Those I’d purchased at 2XL to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Baker

customer_reviews.title: waterproof as advertised
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. Pretty durable so far but we'll have to revisit once I've put more miles in to it. I have a size 10 1/2 wide boot and they fit in the large perfect with a little room to wiggle. Road them in the rain and I've never been so happy to have dry feet... ; ) Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Not for extended use on concrete.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a low score due to the fact that both tore on me the first time I used them. However, I must note that I work outside on concrete walking for upwards of 8 hours. I don't believe these would be good for long term use. If you need something for average use, I believe these would suit you well. Again, the average person should be fine using these.
customer_reviews.author: OkeesWorld

customer_reviews.title: Multifunctional shoe safety covers
customer_reviews.text: So after a bilateral foot amputation and no toes I was struggling to find snow shoes for winter in the Midwest. I can’t go outside because snow will soak through my sneakers. Bought these and they are a god send. Fits perfectly over my shoes and kept me safe, dry and slip free. Ended up buying extra pairs to have on hand. Turning one set into bowling shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Kiolbasa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect jungle boots
customer_reviews.text: These boots were perfect for my needs. I was going to the Amazon Jungle and would be doing some walking, and needed some light, packable boots. These were perfect! They took practically no room in my bag and fit over my sturdy shoes just right. I have no idea how durable they would be because I only hiked in them for maybe 2 hours. I was worried I would slide around in the mud in them but that was not at all the case. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy rain covers for wet days ☔️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⛈
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy rain covers for a wet days, ....these fold flat so we’ll pack these in suitcases on next travels. One could use these on water rides at theme parks to keep walking or running shoes from getting soaked ⭐️👍😎we liked these so ordered a pair for our son 👍🤓
customer_reviews.author: T. S. C. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Worked awesome for 1.5 seasons and going
customer_reviews.text: Road it all lat fall and this year with no issues, easy to put on, didn't rip like other brands do after a few uses. Rode hours in the rain through multiple states, highway speeds, boots and feet were dry. I recommend these over other cheap brands.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Vermillion

customer_reviews.title: no thanks
customer_reviews.text: Its so insulated, feet and legs are wet from sweat. Ive tried without rain, and same result-sweat. When raining, inside of boots are not wet so I know im not moist from rain seeping in. Regardless, I still end up wet so I can't advocate for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Nbykc

customer_reviews.title: Worked well in the snow
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product ! Folds down flat . The largest size fit my size 13 shoe. I was able to wear my regular shoes (with this over my shoes) when everyone else had to wear their snow boots to go to the restaurant . They seem to have good traction and I assume will be durable but have not used them much . Really came in handy.
customer_reviews.author: ticino

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I used these in Iceland when photographing glaciers on Diamond Beach, where the surf often comes up quickly without much notice (sneaker waves I guess they are called). I had these on and never had a problem with the water getting in. Others had on waders on and I'm sure those are best if you need protection up the waist. But these worked great for water that came up mid shin, almost to the knee, multiple times. For the price I was highly impressed, and will purchase them again when the time comes (I had to leave them to Iceland, no more room in my bag).
customer_reviews.author: ChrisW

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat flimsy, but worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: We needed some water proof shoes for a fishing trip. We ordered these because we liked that they were able to easily go over our shoes, they were light weight (we were flying and were taking them in our suit case), and inexpensive. They were great for all of those reasons, but they were super flimsy and there's a strap that goes over the top of the foot that kept coming off. We got a few great uses out of them on our trip, and for the cost we felt they were worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Tibbitts

customer_reviews.title: Used as walking boot cover.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the size XL. I used this as a cover for my size small actimove tall walking boot. It fit my medical boot perfect. It kept my boot clean and dry when walking outside. It was much cheaper than covers made for walking boots.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stillwell

customer_reviews.title: Great for biking!
customer_reviews.text: Started biking for health reasons, but getting your shoes wet is always frustrating as heck (specially if you need to move around on a city with very unpredictable weather). This ones worked great with my normal plastic pedals, tried them on a pouring raining day and grip was amazing and worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Aulestia

customer_reviews.title: Totally waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for bike commuting in the rain. I've only used them twice for a short period of time, but they seem to be great. They fit well over my shoes and are totally waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: David D.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these once and while walking in grass I hit one against the other and it caused a hole. I was only wearing a soft flexible sneaker so there was no way the shoes caused it. I feel the material the boots are made of is too weak.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: Works well, they don’t slide down your leg. Feet stay dry.
customer_reviews.text: My feet stay dry. I really like how far they go up my calf, they don’t fall down and makes it much easier to use the foot controls. The “no slip” souls have a good grip on the ground when I’m stopped. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Curley

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Like most, you can put them right over your shoes. Not heels but flats. Perfect for the walk through a parking lot with little puddles everywhere and if a place is muddy. Definitely worth the price. I have 5 pair just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald dixon

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the XL for my husband who wears a size US 10 wide. They barely fit him. And one of his pair of athletic shoes did NOT fit in the boots. After wearing them for a couple of months they got a tear near the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof and high enough to stop water from getting in
customer_reviews.text: They were perfect for wet landing from a zodiac. They are waterproof and high enough to prevent water from coming in on my hiking boots. They are easy to put on and have a support strap across the ankle to hold them in place. I’m pleased
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Dont hold up.
customer_reviews.text: This product has the right idea but just dont last. They are already ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Booth

customer_reviews.title: Torn on the second day.
customer_reviews.text: Torn on the second day. Not even waterproof. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R.

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your expectations....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe cover to keep my shoes dry when I pressure wash the driveway....great product for light, occasional use. The boots are made of thin material, so hard use will not be so successful....these are definitely NOT work boots. They are shoe covers.
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: Protection from water for my wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a "rain boot" that I can get on my wide feet with high instep. I have tried boots that are 2 sizes larger and I can't get my foot into other boots past the instep. This design was the solution I have sought for five years. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Calfla

customer_reviews.title: Well-made and does the job.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for an hour. I walk 17-20 miles a day delivering mail. If you only need them briefly, they're awesome. If you need them for longer periods of time: after an hour of walking in these, your feet will be so soaked in sweat trapped inside from not breathing, that you may as well take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Ronin Moon

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.text: These seem amazing!!! I'm an idiot and bought the large pair thinking I would need them to fit over my sneakers. They are WAAY to big for me I can't even wear them. For the price they are high quality and def seem like they would be completely waterproof. I would definitely recommend buying these- just buy your true shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia Braucht

customer_reviews.title: They don't keep your feet dry and rip easily at seems
customer_reviews.text: I tried using these several times when riding my motorcycle on wet roads and when it was raining and they failed to keep my feet dry. They fit snug around my calf but have a small space above the zipper that lets water through and after trying to use them several times I am throwing them away. My feet and shoes were soaked from just light rain and wet roads. Additionally when I went to unbutton them once they tore. Not stitched well. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Dains

customer_reviews.title: So compact and better than rubber galoshes
customer_reviews.text: This is one great product to keep you’re feet and clothes dry in the rain and snow. In deep snow or ice a great add on would be ice tracks to prevent accidental slipping. The bottom of this boot has a rubber sole that’s good for traction but not for ice.
customer_reviews.author: A. Provenz

customer_reviews.title: Great for covering moms orthopedics
customer_reviews.text: My mom has to wear orthopedics but they aren't waterproof and can not be coated in any water resistant sprays 😔 ...took me a while to find these covers and we are both very satisfied with them. The aren't the cutest things but they fit over her shoes perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Becky Chiocca

customer_reviews.title: Water proof
customer_reviews.text: The seem durable if treated with respect. I visually inspected all seams and they were good. I stood in a foot of water and they didn't leak. The fit was good. Snug at the calf. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: mjkilb

customer_reviews.title: Real quality product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize just how nice these were going to be, but they are just great! Really comfortable and fit perfectly over boots without being bulky. Heavy duty material keeps you perfectly dry, great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Camisman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We used these for a trip to Iceland and they worked great for walking through the streams. We had two pairs and only one of the boots gave use trouble getting it to fit over the shoes, but we did eventually get it. We didn't use them that much, but where we did we stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised with this product. It kept our feet dry and the snow out. I just wore them with slippers to keep my feet warm. Perfect for out weekend getaway in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: They're not bad. I wear daily for the snow on the bike. Downside, grip is meh at best. Also, the fabric comes apart fast when around any Velcro. It's cheap, and works for the most part, but you can't beat up on it all the much.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca  Calderoni

customer_reviews.title: Good for in a pinch boots
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. Can be a struggle to put in over your shoes. Not sure why but after a few times wearing them In Seattle’s weather my shoes were moist when I took off the boots.
customer_reviews.author: Keiffer

product_meta.title: USHTH Black Waterproof Rain Boot Shoe Cover with reflector (1 Pair)
product_meta.description:
Highlights Of the Shoes Cover 

--1. Plastics strap snaps over your foot for a snug fit 

--2. Super easy to slip on with full length side zipper 

--3. Safety reflector on heel 

--4. Tightly fit with elastic surrounding on the top 

--5. Made of high quality waterproof PVC material keeping dry and clean for your expensive shoes and boots, extending the lifetime of your footwear. 

--6. Not only perfect for cycling,Motorcycle,traveling, hiking, walking; but also use for daily life, wear it doing cleaning work in home. put on it to School, Office, Garden, Park, Farm, Beach in rainy day. 

--7. Nonslip Rubber Bottom to ensure your safety; New generation touched soft and super comfortable wear feel；Reusable, anti skidding; fordable and portable;Easy to clean; 


NOTE:There are three different size for optional,please measure your actual sole length before buying.We advise to choose the size of shoes cover longer than your usual shoes sole length 0.5-0.8inch.
feature_bullets: ♦[Quality PVC Fabric: All Angle Protections] - 100% high elastic PVC materials. 100% Solid Water, Oil, Dustproof & Anti-skid compatibilities.
♦[Portable Foldable and Reusable] - Every pair of shoes cover comes with a waterproof package bag, you can easily put them in your bag after use.
♦[Unique design] - 1. Safety reflector on heel ; 2. Comprehensive waterproof zipper.
♦[Fashion And Adjustable Design] - Fashionable sport style; Wide mouth design,easy to put on and off; Good elasticity of the surrounding on the top,convenient to adjust to the degree of tightness.

♦[Wide Applications] - You can wear rain snow shoes covers to do Cleaning Washing Cycling Motorcycle Traveling Camping Hiking Fishing Hunting Shooting Farming Painting etc.✮✮✮FREE exchange size and 100% money back guarantee if you are not satisfied✮✮✮
